title: Boy George: I didn't make Paloma Faith cry on The Voice
text:
Boy George: I didn't make Paloma Faith cry on The Voice Boy George: I didn't make Paloma Faith cry on The Voice 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Boy George has denied that he was responsible for his fellow judge on The Voice Paloma Faith shedding tears during an episode of the show. 
The Only Love Can Hurt Like This singer got emotional while arguing for an act on the BBC singing show, after Boy George reportedly sniped at her for mocking his own pitch. Ha. Love you @Palomafaith it's just 'banter-mime! pic.twitter.com/4t3PVmXVrn 
— Boy George (@BoyGeorge) September 30, 2015 
But Boy George said there are no bad feelings between them. 
He told Digital Spy: “First of all, nobody makes anyone cry, crying is a personal choice. And Paloma’s gorgeous, I worship and adore her. 
“And we had a right laugh about it afterwards. And she sent me a note saying ‘I will never do it again’ and she did it again! The Voice 2015 judges – Ricky Wilson, Paloma Faith, Boy George and Will.i.am (John Giles/PA) 
The 54-year-old singer continued: “So, we know where we stand. I’ve known her for a long time, and we’ve been out to dinner so you know, we’ll cope with each other, it’s fine. 
“Initially, it’s all about finding out where people’s boundaries are, what you can get away with, what you can say to them. Now we know where we stand.” 
Boy George went on to say that he’s “absolutely loving” his time on the BBC reality competition alongside returning judges Ricky Wilson and Will.i.am. 
— Boy George (@BoyGeorge) September 26, 2015 
“It’s fantastic. It’s a lot of fun,” he said. 
“We’ve got our teams now so now we’re going to go on to the next bit and find a winner.” Share article 
The Voice UK returns in early 2016 on BBC One. Promoted Stories
